channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11815] Flush and compaction could just close the tmp writer if there is an exception
item.description:
A minor change.


        try {

          flushed = performFlush(scanner, writer, smallestReadPoint);

        } finally {

          finalizeWriter(writer, cacheFlushId, status);

        }

Whenever there is a failure during flush we should close the writer but adding the meta data and setting the status would not be needed.


    status.setStatus("Flushing " + store + ": appending metadata");

    writer.appendMetadata(cacheFlushSeqNum, false);

    status.setStatus("Flushing " + store + ": closing flushed file");

    writer.close();
item.summary: Flush and compaction could just close the tmp writer if there is an exception

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

Patch lgtm. We failing when we try to add the metadata after getting an IOE? That would make sense. Should we do this on every IOE? Will we have files that are half-written ramkrishna.s.vasudevan w/o their metadata? Do they get cleaned up on IOE? If so, +1.

Do they get cleaned up on IOE? If so, +1.

As far as I see there is no use of these failed flushed files in the temp directory. Do you think the meta data in this file would be useful? Let me verify once again and then commit this. Thanks Stack!!
oh.. if they are out in /tmp, then yeah, they are not inline. +1 on patch. Saves us trying to write meta that is unlikely to succeed since we've an outstanding ioe
Patch doesn't apply to 0.98. Moving to .7
Can i rebase and apply it to 0.98 Andrew Purtell?

Can i rebase and apply it to 0.98 Andrew Purtell?

Please do Ram!
+1 from me as well.
We could commit this with updated/rebased patches.
I will rebase this soon. Thanks for the headsup. Excuse typos.
Attaching rebased patches and for 0.98
